reviewText: I was so happy when I found this and it was on sale for such a good price.  My wife is a 24 junkie and our DVR was so full of these episodes, up to 67 I think, that I was going nuts trying to have enough to space to record the shows I wanted to save.  She hasn't noticed that I have deleted most of the 24 episodes, though, as school had begun and she is busy with her teaching duties.  I will have all these episodes erased soon and will have to profusely apologize to her for doing so.  Then this Christmas I will give her this set and I will be forgiven for my transgressions.  She will be happy and I will be happy and all will be well.  I recommend these for every guy who has a wife who just has to have all one thousand episodes of 24 at her fingertips.

reviewText: I'd never seen an episode of "24" when I purchased it, but for a hundred bucks (Gold Box sale) I figured, what the heck. It had been highly recommended, so I ordered away, and when it arrived I lay in bed with a portable player and watched the whole damn thing. Why did I use a portable player? Because my wife wanted to watch TV occasionally, and once I started watching the series, I couldn't stop. One disk after another, episode after episode. My life raced past me and my wife almost divorced me. Outings were a chore and I lived to come back to that blasted player.When I was done, I was done. And it changed my views. Water boarding? Yes I'm for it and break their knees if that doesn't work! Water boarding is for sissies. If a terrorist has a nuclear device hidden in a big city, are you telling me no one's going to water board him? You've got to be kidding! Start at his ankle and work your way up with a 9mm...and get Donald Sutherland on the phone!For those who haven't watched this series, get it at your own risk. It might ruin your marriage and turn you into a ranting right-winger! The series is selling for $165, which is chicken feed for the rush you'll experience. It's like being on a roller coaster ride that doesn't end. Oh, and don't get attached to any of the characters...that's very important. Got a terrorist? Strap him into a chair and make him watch the series...then give Donald Sutherland a Glock and have him walk into the room. I guarantee the guy will cooperate, and he'll probably need a change of underwear!Seriously, I bought the series thinking I was going to watch it then sell it (such is how I rationalize my purchases). But I'm going to wait another six months and watch it again. That'll be about a year and a half since I saw it the first time. Then I'll sell it...maybe. Being a Stargate SG-1 fan, look for some of the actors making brief appearances. The way things go in this series reminds me of Dorothy's observation in the Wizard of Oz: "People come and go so quickly here!" Anyway, enjoy, then lend it to one of your liberal friends!

reviewText: When I originally purchased this product, it took me several months to watch all of DVDs. In the end, I had eight  problem disks that would either freeze up, skip ahead, had an episode that would not play, and one even had the words written across the screen in the last episode. (Very annoying if you do not need them. It keeps your attention away from the picture!) I contacted Amazon, and even though it had been three to four months since I had ordered this product, they still sent a new complete set to me. I watched the copies of the new disks that matched the old ones with problems, and they were all fine. I replaced those disks in my set with the new ones, and sent the second product back. Amazon reimbursed me for all my shipping costs and everything. I am now very pleased with this purchase. The video and audio on this set is of excellent quality. But then, I figure if I am going to pay $200 for something, it should be perfect!

Actors need to realize that what they say and do does reflect on their performance. Many do it as instructed by their managers to stay in the public view by any means, but they need to temper their comments and actions so as not to alienate a large segment of the demographic that they hope to entertain.Freedom of Speech was never intended to allow citizens to say untrue, hurtful or unpopular commentary. The founders intended to guarantee our right to challenge with impunity the government not each other.

reviewText: I only paid one hundred dollars for this entire series as part of a Best Buy special, and it was a great purchase.  My only gripe, if there is one, is the extreme lag time between each episode and the need to regurgitate the previous show in the beginning where just skipping the first scene does not work because the episode starts in the first scene.  There should have been an option to eliminate the countdown delays in between scenes also.I've only watched seasons 7 and 8 on TV.  Therefore, I am now plowing through all the early seasons and losing a lot of sleep because of this.  I may have to rewatch a lot of the scenes since the DVD offers a lot of deleted scenes and those with commentary too.  An incredible deal for the price I paid.

reviewText: I can agree with the rest of the people here about 24 being an exception series.  This is a word of warning to overseas buyers, this series is embedded with the new Regional Coding Enhancement.  This means that some of the region free players won't play it (my Kogan TV/DVD is one) make sure you can change the region on your DVD player to Region 1 as it will not play on some region free players.  You may need to find a site that gives you unlock codes to be able to do this.

reviewText: This was, as most folks know, a great series.Be prepared to take hours and hours to watch this.It is wonderful to see each season's villain come and go and how they react to the situations.Turncoats abound from season to season.People we trust and love as viewers end up to be pieces of crap, and those we dislike in some cases turn out to have a few redeeming qualities.There seems to be no end to heads running CTU, then getting arrested, shot, imprisoned, then released, then coming back to aid Jack in his quest to overcome insurmountable odds!This is a great series, and the only reason I sold it after watching it, I will likely never have another 100 hours or so to watch it again!I recommend it highly.
summary: BOUGHT IT, WATCHED IT ALL, AND SOLD IT....

reviewText: Every so often, a show comes around that reinvents television for ever. The X-Files reinvented Sci-Fi. Seinfeld reinvented comedy. 24 does for Serialized Action dramas what these shows did for their respective genres. What's great about 24 is that nothing like it had ever been seen before. It was bold. It was fresh. It was exciting. Each season consists of 24 one-hour long episodes. Jack Bauer, a federal agent, needs to stop some kind of act of terrorism (it's new every season.) But there's a twist: it takes place in real time. Each hour is an hour in the show universe as well, meaning, when all is said and done, each season is a day in the life of Jack Bauer. Meticulously assembled (at least in the first 5 or so seasons), the real-time aspect made the show. A drive across town might take half an episode, but it's frustrating when a life is on the line. Traffic lights are excruciating, especially if Jack's wife and daughter are kidnapped by terrorists, and we know in moments, they might die. If a terrorist claims they will attack at the end of the hour, the suspense will last until the end of the episode. Even better (or worse if you've started to watch late at night), is that each and every episode ends with a game-changing cliffhanger. You will wonder how the writers can come up with so many twists, but they consistently top themselves. The acting is phenomenal, although a little shaky in season one. As the characters were more fleshed out and the actors settled in, their parts were more believable, emotional, and heartfelt. The show is pretty violent and uses torture many times in order to extract information from terrorists. This was the subject of much criticism during its run, but I found it wasn't done in an excessive way to "disturb" viewers. It was done "tastefully" (or as tastefully as torture can be. It would have been unrealistic for a terrorist to just pour out his soul to Jack upon his asking. I didn't have a problem with it, but opinions will vary. Simply brace yourself for this. 24 also switched between multiple storylines: How the public reacts, how the White House responds, and how Jack tries to prevent the attacks. 24 was an iconic part of television in the past decade. Its best seasons were seasons 1, 2, 4, and 5, while its weakest were seasons 3 and 6. Towards the end of the series, the writers seemed to not show as much regard for the real-time aspect that defined the show in its earlier years. Rides from one end of town could take place during a commercial break, but the quality of the show was not hindered by this. 24's effects were profound, as it significantly impacted the future of television. Do not miss this exciting, wonderfully acted, and intense series.
summary: Landmark Television That Must Not Be Missed

reviewText: The following takes place on March 30th, 2011 between 7 am and 8 am...I got into 24 approximately one and one-half months ago (it was on Netflix). I had watched it on TV a couple of times and had never gotten into it - it's not a drop on in kind of show, really... is it? So I started at season 1 episode 1 and just went. By season 3 episode 1 I was completely convinced that I NEEDED to own this show... all of it... every last bit.I actually bought the set at Best Buy (sorry Amazon, I wanted it NOW!!!) and the price was a little more but was not outrageous.I opened the box to find all 8 days inside plus Redemption (the 2 hour 24 made for TV movie that falls between day 6 and day 7, naughty writers striking) and quietly tucked in the back of the box was a solitary disc in a paperboard cover full of special features.The TV to DVD transfer is flawless and the show looks beautiful. I own a Blu-Ray player and I don't know that Blu-Ray could do the picture much justice but admittedly the sound would probably be a touch better.The only thing I REALLY have to complain at all about is that I like box sets with little extras. For example, the complete X-Files box set had an episode review guide and a comic stuck into a "drawer" at the bottom of the box. Perhaps 24 could have done something similar? I digress however. My overall satisfaction far outweighs any petty dissatisfaction.Final synopsis? AWESOME!!! If you're on the fence about buying, just do it. This show is well worth it. ;D

reviewText: 24 was definitely a series that had its ups and downs.  The first couple seasons were very ground breaking with the "real time" format, and the fact that it was never afraid to kill off a character.  There were certainly hokey and dumb moments throughout the series, but I think on the whole the plots and the acting were very good.  I definitely think the series did try to hang on too long.  I think it would have stood up better if it ended after 4 or 5 seasons instead of going 8.  Like many I think that the 6th season was the weakest of the group.  While seasons 7 and 8 did help it recover, I do think it was a show that would have benefited from a shorter run, especially since there was talk of a possible movie long before the series ended.  Overall I think it was a well acted, well written series that was (especially at the beginning) very addicting.  It did take a lot of suspension of disbelief and you have to be willing to accept some eye rolling moments, but on the whole it was a very entertaining series.

reviewText: The show itself is amazing, never a dull moment and I highly recommend it.  The acting, writing, cinematography were all exceptional.  Each episode was an edge of your seat kind of show.  The packaging, on the other hand, was rather cheap.  My entire 5th season DVDs do not stay in the box.  There are cheap plastic parts which were broken in the 5th season box.  But between the sales price (deal of the day) and my accumulated Amazon points, it only cost me $56 so I am not complaining.  After all the show itself is just amazing.  I have not viewed the 5th season yet from this set, but they do not look at all to be damaged.
summary: One of the greatest tv shows ever!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: 24 hours straight, that is how many hours in a row you will want to watch this if you get the whole series at once.  I can't believe this and Prison Break came on the same night as 24.  I didn't have a DVR at the time and was working 2 jobs so I didn't see either.  When I think of the number 24 for now on,  I will think of Jack Bauer. (& Kobe Bryant, LoL) Kiefer Sutherland has moved way up on my favorite list of actors because of this series.  He had to use all emotions for this character and he did it well.  There are MANY other characters to like in this series as well.  As the series grew more popular in the 8 seasons, more & more well known actors made appearances in later seasons.  I can understand why they wanted to have their name attached to this series.  I have made facial expressions I have never made watching this series.  My mouth was left wide open many nights from all the action, twist, drama and suspense in this wonderfully produced and written series.  The acting was well done to say the least. I went to work tired many nights from trying to squeeze in another episode.  It took me forever to finish the final episode because I hated to see this end.  So if you are late watching this series like me,  do yourself a favor and pick up this 190 plus episode masterpiece!  Remember....EVENTS HAPPEN IN REALTIME! Yo. will know what I am talking about after you start watching the series!

reviewText: Action packed storylines in each of 8 seasons as well as the 2 hour special which was shown between series 6 and 7.  While the terrorist attacks depicted in this series did not actually occur, the superb acting draws you in, holds your attention, and leads you to cheer for the protagonists and loath the villains. The concept is a suspense packed 24 hour day for each season.  Because there are no commercials what took an hour on television actually takes about 43 minutes to view.

reviewText: I just got done watching the whole series of 24. Although I did watch it when it came on t.v. I missed the first five seasons. I really didn't start watching it until season 6. In my opinion this was the last good show on prime time television. Each season on show starts off with CTU trying to do what at first seems to be a simple task but later turns into a near impossible one with Jack Bauer (Kiefer Sutherland) caught in the middle of it all. I really enjoyed watching the show and can't wait for the movie to come out next year.
summary: The last good show on prime time T.V.
